results.title: The Potential Therapeutic Application of Simvastatin for Brain Complications and Mechanisms of Action
results.text_hl: Recent studies have suggested that @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ could be a promising therapeutic option for different @DISEASE_Brain_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D001927 @@@brain complications@@@ and diseases ranging from @DISEASE_Brain_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D001932 @@@brain tumors@@@ (i.e., @DISEASE_Medulloblastoma @DISEASE_MESH:D008527 @@@medulloblastoma@@@ and @DISEASE_Glioblastoma @DISEASE_MESH:D005909 @@@glioblastoma@@@) to @DISEASE_Neurologic_Manifestations @DISEASE_MESH:D009461 @@@neurological disorders@@@ (i.e., @<m>DISEASE_Alzheimer_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000544 @@@Alzheimer's disease@@@, @DISEASE_Parkinson_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D010300 @@@Parkinson's disease@@@, and @DISEASE_Huntington_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D006816 @@@Huntington's disease@@@).

citations.NLM: Vuu YM, Kadar Shahib A, Rastegar M. The Potential Therapeutic Application of Simvastatin for Brain Complications and Mechanisms of Action Pharmaceuticals (Basel). 2023 Jun 22;16(7):. PMID: 37513826
citations.BibTeX: @article{37513826, title={The Potential Therapeutic Application of Simvastatin for Brain Complications and Mechanisms of Action}, author={Vuu YM and Kadar Shahib A and Rastegar M}, journal={Pharmaceuticals (Basel)}, volume={16}, number={7}}

results.title: Simvastatin rescues memory and granule cell maturation through the Wnt/beta-catenin signaling pathway in a mouse model of Alzheimer's disease
results.text_hl: We previously showed that @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ (@<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@SV@@@) restored memory in a @SPECIES_10090 @@@mouse@@@ model of @<m>DISEASE_Alzheimer_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000544 @@@Alzheimer disease@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Alzheimer_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000544 @@@AD@@@) concomitantly with normalization in protein levels of memory-related immediate early genes in hippocampal CA1 neurons.

citations.NLM: Tong XK, Royea J, Hamel E. Simvastatin rescues memory and granule cell maturation through the Wnt/beta-catenin signaling pathway in a mouse model of Alzheimer's disease Cell Death Dis. 2022 Apr 9;13(4):325. PMID: 35397630
citations.BibTeX: @article{35397630, title={Simvastatin rescues memory and granule cell maturation through the Wnt/beta-catenin signaling pathway in a mouse model of Alzheimer's disease}, author={Tong XK and Royea J and Hamel E}, journal={Cell Death Dis}, volume={13}, number={4}, pages={325}}

results.title: Association of combination statin and antihypertensive therapy with reduced Alzheimer's disease and related dementia risk
results.text_hl: Among @SPECIES_9606 @@@men@@@, with the exception of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, combine use of any statin and either ACEI or ARB was associated with lower odds of @<m>DISEASE_Alzheimer_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000544 @@@ADRD@@@ incidence.

citations.NLM: Barthold D, Joyce G, Diaz Brinton R, Wharton W, Kehoe PG, Zissimopoulos J. Association of combination statin and antihypertensive therapy with reduced Alzheimer's disease and related dementia risk PLoS One. 2020;15(3):e0229541. PMID: 32130251
citations.BibTeX: @article{32130251, title={Association of combination statin and antihypertensive therapy with reduced Alzheimer's disease and related dementia risk}, author={Barthold D and Joyce G and Diaz Brinton R and Wharton W and Kehoe PG and Zissimopoulos J}, journal={PLoS One}, volume={15}, number={3}, pages={e0229541}}

results.title: Probiotics Fermentation Technology, a Novel Kefir Product, Ameliorates Cognitive Impairment in Streptozotocin-Induced Sporadic Alzheimer's Disease in Mice
results.text_hl: These beneficial effects were comparable to those produced by @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@. The results suggest that PFT can alleviate @<m>DISEASE_Alzheimer_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000544 @@@AD@@@ symptoms by regulating the gut microbiota and by inhibiting @<m>DISEASE_Alzheimer_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000544 @@@AD@@@-related pathological events.

citations.NLM: El Sayed NS, Kandil EA, Ghoneum MH. Probiotics Fermentation Technology, a Novel Kefir Product, Ameliorates Cognitive Impairment in Streptozotocin-Induced Sporadic Alzheimer's Disease in Mice Oxid Med Cell Longev. 2021;2021():5525306. PMID: 34306309
citations.BibTeX: @article{34306309, title={Probiotics Fermentation Technology, a Novel Kefir Product, Ameliorates Cognitive Impairment in Streptozotocin-Induced Sporadic Alzheimer's Disease in Mice}, author={El Sayed NS and Kandil EA and Ghoneum MH}, journal={Oxid Med Cell Longev}, volume={2021}, pages={5525306}}

results.text_hl: Cumulative effect of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, @CHEMICAL_Arginine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001120 @@@l-arginine@@@, and @CHEMICAL_sapropterin @CHEMICAL_MESH:C003402 @@@tetrahydrobiopterin@@@ on cerebral blood flow and cognitive function in @<m>DISEASE_Alzheimer_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000544 @@@Alzheimer's disease@@@

results.title: HMG-CoA reductase inhibitor simvastatin ameliorates trimethyltin neurotoxicity and cognitive impairment through reversal of Alzheimer's-associated markers.
results.text_hl: For inducing @<m>DISEASE_Alzheimer_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000544 @@@AD@@@-like phenotype, @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ were i.p. injected with @CHEMICAL_trimethyltin @CHEMICAL_MESH:C046488 @@@TMT@@@ at 8 mg/kg and were treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ daily for 3 weeks at 10 or 30 mg/kg.

citations.NLM: Salari A, Roghani M, Khalili M. HMG-CoA reductase inhibitor simvastatin ameliorates trimethyltin neurotoxicity and cognitive impairment through reversal of Alzheimer's-associated markers. Metab Brain Dis. 2024 Dec 20;40(1):74. PMID: 39704877

results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ (@<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@SMV@@@) improved memory function experimentally and clinically.
